thread.title: Pep Rally gets fans ready for Basketball season
thread.title_full: Pep Rally gets fans ready for Basketball season

author: Brandon Soliz Staff Writer
title: Pep Rally gets fans ready for Basketball season
text:
Pep Rally gets fans ready for Basketball season By Brandon Soliz 0 
The DT's Emma Adams, Juan Gil, Brionne Dunham, Kris Mamwacha and Ryan Ortegon report. 
Texas Tech fans were able to come out to the United Supermarkets Arena the Friday before the homecoming football game against Iowa State to see this years Lady Raider and Red Raider basketball teams. 
Both Tech women’s coach Candi Whitaker and men’s coach Tubby Smith introduced themselves and their basketball squads, as well as showing off their team’s shooting and dunking abilities in a three-point contest and dunking contest in front of a crowd that was near the 5,000 mark in attendants. 
Whitaker was able to recruit some new talent for the Lady Raiders and showed off sophomore transfer Receé Caldwell’s shooting ability in the three-point contest. 
“It’s a great way to kickoff our season,” Whitaker said. “We had our first week of practice and we learned a lot and got a lot done, so we’re just working to get better every day and we’re excited to see how much better we are this year from last year.” 
On the men’s side, coach Smith is looking forward to seeing how his team is able to bounce back from last season and it started in a trip to Canada where the team won all four of its games up north across the border. 
“We have guys like Aaron Ross healthy and we have gotten stronger physically and mentally so I know that we will be competitive,” Smith said. “We have a very tough schedule and as always the Big 12 will be the most competitive conference in the country. 
Tech forward Zach Smith was able to show off his dunking ability as he beat freshman Jordan Jackson in a performance that sent the crowd into a frenzy. 
Tech coach Tubby Smith said he is ready to see what Jackson and freshman CJ Williamson can do for the team when the season begins with a group that has younger players ready to help the Red Raiders. 
“I think guys like CJ (Williamson) and Jordan (Jackson), Jordan (Jackson) who actually led us in scoring in Canada in the tour, will actually be able to contribute right away along with the other younger guys.” 
Both the Lady Raiders and Red Raiders begin their seasons on Nov. 13 when the Lady Raiders play Niagara at 11 a.m. followed by the men’s team facing off against High Point, which is coach Smith’s alma-mater, at 8 p.m., both at the United Supermarkets Arena. ×
